summary: Crypto venture capital firm Paradigm is saying goodbye to its CFO Nathan Apsel and General Counsel Reena Jashnani-Slusarz.
title: Paradigm CFO and General Counsel set to depart firm this month
content: Crypto venture capital firm Paradigm, one of the most established and active players in the space, is saying goodbye to its CFO Nathan Apsel and General Counsel Reena Jashnani-Slusarz.
The two will depart the firm in mid-September, according to an internal email that was obtained by The Block. The company didn't provide a comment.

"Over the last 2+ years with their help, we have doubled in size, launched our first venture fund, hosted our first in person LP Summit, and welcomed many great colleagues to our Legal and Finance teams," COO Alana Palmedo said in the email.

"I want to thank both of them for their tremendous contributions and helping us build Paradigm into what we are today," Palmedo continued. "Our Legal and Finance teams are fierce and powerful thanks to you!"
Katie Biber, who joined as Chief Legal Officer over a year ago, will continue to lead the legal team, according to a person familiar with the plans who was not able to discuss the matter publicly.
The company will be announcing a new CFO in the coming months, the person added.
The company isn't reducing overall headcount, the person said, pointing out recent new hires such as Alex Grieve on the policy team and Cookie Wiese as People Lead.
